## Example 1: Basic for loop to print values

```{r}
for(i in 1:5){
  print(paste("this iteration is", i, ".", sep=""))
}
```

## Example 2: Using a for loop to fill a vector

```{r}
squares <- matrix(NA, nrow=10, ncol= 10)

for(i in 1:ncol(squares)){
  squares[i,] <- i^2
}

squares


```

## Example 3: Using a for loop with an if-statement

```{r}
temps <- c(12, 18, 23, 5, 30, 0)

for(t in temps){
  if(t > 20){
    print(paste(t, "is warm"))
  } 
}


```
